description: [Ethiopian Herald] Ethiopia will see between 30,000 and 130,000 new green jobs by 2030, mainly in energy and power production
title: Africa: Africa's Green Economy Could Create More Than 3 Million Direct Jobs By 2030 - Research

description: [Africa Check] IN SHORT: Short videos circulating on Facebook with "health secrets" for slowing down ageing contain nothing but unreliable home "remedies". What's more, these videos are unusual in that they are not only inaccurate, but also impersonate another untrustworthy source.
title: Africa: Don't Trust Home Remedies From Video Mimicking Untrustworthy 'Naturopath' Barbara O'neill

description: [Daily Maverick] Minister Parks Tau is also holding meetings in Washington with Biden administration officials to try to ensure that South Africa is not dropped from the trade agreement.
title: Africa: SA Trade Minister Parks Tau Urges Us to Extend Agoa to Help Africa Industrialise

description: [Ghanaian Times] Ghana's desire to fast-track its renewable energy rate had a major boost when a 16.82 megawatts rooftop photo voltaic solar plant was inaugurated in Tema yesterday.
title: Africa: Africa's Largest Rooftop Solar Plant Inaugurated in Tema

description: [Business Day Africa] EBC Financial Group (EBC) recently hosted an event titled "Revolutionising CFD Trading with DiNapoli's Leading Indicators," where they announced a new partnership with renowned trader and author Joe DiNapoli.
title: Africa: EBC Partners With Joe Dinapoli to Enhance CFD Trading

description: [The Conversation Africa] We often hear about the importance of the human microbiome - the vast collection of bacteria and fungi that live on and inside us - when it comes to our health. But there's another, equally important part of this microbial community that remains far less known: the virome.
title: Africa: The Human Virome - Why Viruses Could Be As Important for Good Health As Gut Bacteria

description: [UN News] The UN chief on Thursday issued an urgent call to action to better protect billions around the world exposed to crippling effects of extreme heat, as global temperature rise continues unabated.
title: Africa: The Heat Is On - We Must Rise to the Challenge of Rising Temperatures, Urges UN Chief

description: [Business Day Africa] The COMESA-EAC-SADC Tripartite Free Trade Area (TFTA) Agreement is set to come into force today, following the attainment of the required ratification threshold.
title: Africa: Tripartite Agreement Takes Effect After Reaching Ratification Threshold

description: [IPS] Bulawayo, Zimbabwe -- As the African diaspora continues its growth, agencies are seeking ways to tap into this vast demographic to help with the continent's development.
title: Africa: African Diaspora to Drive Continent's Development Ambitions

description: [IPS] Nairobi -- Prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, approximately 116 million people in the African region were living with mental health conditions. A large proportion of mental disorders is caused by depression and anxiety, and these conditions take a significant toll on health and wellbeing of people aged 15 to 59 years who are most affected.
title: West Africa: Navigating Mental Health Challenges in West Africa

description: [Addis Standard] Addis Abeba -- Several world leaders are offering condolences following a landslide in the Kencho Shacha Gozdi village, Gofa Zone, South Ethiopia Regional State, on Monday that resulted in over 257 fatalities.
title: Africa: Russia's Putin, South Africa's Ramaphosa Offer Condolences Following Deadly Southern Ethiopia Landslide

description: [allAfrica] Munich, Germany -- Diplomacy and foreign policy prescribe health as a critical component that impacts economic prosperity, global development, and security. Policy decisions in these areas directly influence health outcomes and the spread of disease.
title: Africa: 'We Have to Build Solidarity Across Movements' - Clark on Ending HIV Pandemic #Aids2024

description: [VOA] Nairobi, Kenya -- The 2024 Olympics begin Friday, with more than 10,000 athletes gathering in Paris dreaming of winning gold, silver or bronze. Among them will be dozens of women from African countries, many of whom have overcome major social and economic challenges to get to Paris.
title: Africa: Women Athletes Aim to Beat 17 Olympic Medals Won in Tokyo

description: [African Arguments] Debating Ideas reflects the values and editorial ethos of the African Arguments book series, publishing engaged, often radical, scholarly, original and activist writing from within the African continent and beyond. It offers debates and engagements, contexts and controversies, and reviews and responses flowing from the African Arguments books. It is edited and managed by the International African Institute, hosted at SOAS University of London, the owners of the book series of the same name.
title: Africa: Towards a Sustainable Blue Economy for Africa

description: [allAfrica] With Africa hardly top of mind in Washington right now, it is easy to overlook the vital discussions taking place this week between the Biden-Harris administration's foreign policy, economic and trade A-team and their African counterparts. Cabinet ministers from 32 African countries along with private sector and civil society leaders are participating in the 21st AGOA Forum, named after the African Growth and Opportunity Act. The trade legislation, enacted by Congress in 2000, mandates these get-together
title: Africa: America Can't Be First If Africa Is Always Put Last
